ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course taught me, true to its name, Elementary MSA at an L2 level. Though we only learn MSA, it's a critical step on the path to fluency in Arabic. Learning this language at Yale also does such a good job of demythicizing the Middle East: as Americans, we are taught a specific narrative, and learning about the culture of Middle Eastern countries through the language does a great job of debunking these myths.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: Ustadha Al Ani. She is easily one of the best teachers I've had at Yale, incredibly nice, super smart, and just a wonderful human being.
Strength: This class teaches you Arabic at an L2 level really quickly. 
Strength: Because it's summer session, there are not a lot of students. We had a two person class, which is wonderful for a language because a) our participation was by necessity high, and b) our teacher gave us a lot of personalized feedback.
Strength: a lot of contact hours of Arabic
Weaknesses: Because summer session is only 5 weeks, it's definitely crammed. That said, I still would take this course again.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
Yes, most definitely. L2 with Professor Al Ani was wonderful, and also because of the nature of summer session we had a 2-person class, which helped with participation and hands-on learning as well as teacher feedback. Also, I had so much fun in class, I felt like I got a lot better at Arabic, and I'm prepared for L3! 

I would caution the student that this course is a lot of work, and not for the faint of heart. After our 3 hour class I'd typically have about 3 hours of homework, and the homework (because of it's for a language) is not easy.
